snippet: The Mets’ steadily dwindling crowds at Citi Field are the backdrop to a federal lawsuit filed last week by a former ticket sales executive accusing the team of discrimination.
abstract: Steadily dwindling crowds at New York Mets' Citi Field are backdrop to federal lawsuit filed by Leigh Castergine, ticket sales executive fired in August; Castergine is accusing Mets and Jeff Wilpon, their chief operating officer and son of their owner, of discriminating against her because she was having a child out of wedlock; Mets organization says she was fired for failing to meet sales goals.
lead_paragraph: The Mets’ steadily dwindling crowds at Citi Field are the backdrop to a federal lawsuit filed last week by a former ticket sales executive accusing the team of discrimination.

headline.main: The Mets Face a Vista of Empty Seats and a Lawsuit
headline.print_headline: The Mets Face a Vista of Empty Seats and a Lawsuit Charged With Criticism
